description.narrative: The Project development objective is to improve the equity, integration and sustainability of selected social safety net programs.

condition.narrative: Environmental and Social Standards - LA, Schedule 2, Section I. D.1. "The Borrower shall ensure that the Project is carried out inaccordance with the Environmental and Social Standards, in a manner acceptable to the Bank."

GAD and NGO Inter-Institutional Agreement-LA, Schedule 2 Sec I B.2 "To facilitate the carrying out Part 1.2, the Borrower, throughMIES, shall enter into an agreement with the selected GAD and NGO(Inter-Institutional Agreements) under terms and conditionsacceptable to the Bank which shall include, inter alia, the Borrower and the respective GAD and NGO responsibilities under Part 1.2.

Hiring of a Procurement and a Financial Management specialist (MIES PIU) - LA, Schedule 2, Section I.A. (b) "not later than April15, 2021, ensure that a procurement and a financial management specialists are hired to work full time within MIES PIU, all underterms of reference acceptable to the Bank

Hiring of a Procurement and a Financial Management specialist (SRU PIU) - LA, Schedule 2, Section I.A. (d) "not later than October30, 2020, ensure that a procurement and a financial management specialist are hired to work full time within SRU PIU, all underterms of reference acceptable to the Bank.

INEC Inter-institutional Agreement - LA, Schedule 2, Section I. B.1. "To facilitate the carrying out Part 1.1. of the Project, theBorrower, through SRU, shall enter into agreements with INEC (“Inter-Institutional Agreement”), under terms and conditionsacceptable to the Bank, which shall include, inter alia, the Borrower, INEC responsibilities under Part 1.1. of the Project."

INEC Inter-institutional Agreement - LA, Schedule 2, Section I. B.1. "To facilitate the carrying out Part 2.4. of the Project, theBorrower, through MIES, shall enter into agreements with INEC (“Inter-Institutional Agreement”), under terms and conditionsacceptable to the Bank, which shall include, inter alia, the Borrower, INEC responsibilities under Part 2.4. of the Project."

Independent Technical Review Entity (MIES) - LA, Schedule 2, Section II. 2. "The Borrower, through MIES, shall not later thanninety (90) days after Effective Date, select and contract an entity or, independent from the Borrower (Independent TechnicalReview Entity) with experience and qualifications acceptable to the Bank, and in accordance with terms of reference satisfactory tothe Bank.

Independent Technical Review Entity (SRU) - LA, Schedule 2, Section II.3. "The Borrower, through SRU, shall not later than ninety(90) days after Effective Date of this Amendment select and contract an entity, with TORs, experience and qualifications acceptableto the Bank. Entity shall be responsible for the carrying out technical audits each semester, focused on the achievement of DLIs

Inter-institutional Agreement - LA, Schedule 2, Section I. B.3. "To facilitate the carrying out of Parts 1.3 and 3, the Borrower,through MIES, shall enter into an agreement with the selected Concentradores (“Inter-Institutional Agreements”), under terms andconditions acceptable to the Bank, which shall include, inter alia, the Borrower’s and the respective Concentradores’responsibilities.

Operational Manual - LA, Schedule 2, Section I. C.2. "Not later than thirty (30) days after Effective Date of this Amendment, theBorrower shall adopt the Operational Manual in a manner and with contents acceptable to the Bank."

Project Report (MIES) - LA, Schedule 2, Section II. 1. "The Borrower, through MIES, shall furnish to the Bank each Project Reportnot later than forty-five (45) days after the end of each calendar semester, covering the calendar semester."

title.narrative: Percentage of currently BDH beneficiaries from non-poor households (decile 3 and above) with young members (18-29 years old) that receive an economic inclusion package
Percentage of poor households (deciles 1 to 3) with children under three years old receiving BDH or BDH-V with corresponding early childhood development services nationwide
Percentage of elderly in poor households (deciles 1 to 3) receiving UCT and elderly care services nationwide
Percentage of necessary childcare time dedicated by father of extreme poor children
Percentage of extreme poor children aged 0 to 24 months with complete vaccination schedule
Percentage of extreme poor children aged from 0 to 24 months, who have health controls.
Usage of the Social Registry database at the MIES' programs
Strengthening of the GRM for BDH and BDH-V

baseline.value: The baseline is not available yet. It will be available by the end of CY19.

target.value: Response time improved for three main types of complains identified in the preliminary review.

actual.value: The client is incorporating adjustments based on WB comments.

baseline.value: There is no baseline at the moment. Information will be available at the end of the first year.

target.value: Monitoring of: (i) gender equity on time devoted to children care and (ii) women economic autonomy.

actual.value: The client developed a document containing a “Gender profiling of users of MIES economic and social inclusion services”. Thisdocument partially covers the items proposed as project goals and is the baseline to elaborate an action plan limited to itscoverage. In parallel, the client will complete the baseline through the diagnosis of other issues such as women’s time consumingon children care and BDH’s conditionality fulfilment; women economic decisions autonomy within the home; and the secondary schooldropout reduction among girls.

title.narrative: Percentage of poor households enrolled in a twenty-four month CDH integrated service package program
Percentage of non-poor households enrolled in a twelve month CDH integrated service package
Percentage of extreme poor households (decile 1) with updated information in the Social Registry
Depth of the Social Registry Database
Percentage of extreme poor female children under three years old receiving CCTs with corresponding early childhood development services nationwide
Percentage of extreme poor elderly receiving caring services
Percentage of extreme poor indigenous infants with complete package (BDH-V and early childhood services- ECD)
Usage of administrative records in the Social Registry database
Percentage of extreme poor infants attending early childhood development services
Percentage of extreme poor infants receiving cash transfer Bono de Desarrollo Humano Variable (BDH-V)
Percentage of extreme poor indigenous elderly with complete package (PMMA and elderly care services)
Percentage of extreme poor elderly receiving cash transfer PMMA
Beneficiaries of social safety net programs
Percentage of poor households that have been included and are receiving CT packages.
Percentage of poor households (deciles 1 to 3) included in regular cash transfer (CT) programs
